intro: Anarthrophyllum pedicellatum, commonly known as the clustered bladderwort, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the family Lentibulariaceae. It is characterized by its short, erect stems and small, green leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. The plant produces tiny, white flowers that are typically clustered in small groups, giving it its common name. It thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, such as ponds and ditches. Anarthrophyllum pedicellatum is a carnivorous plant, capable of trapping and digesting small aquatic invertebrates to supplement its nutrient intake.
